intro: Neomolina gracilis, commonly known as the slender neomolina, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, hairy stems and small, pentagonal leaves. Its flowers are typically pale pink or white, with five petals and a prominent central stigma. Neomolina gracilis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices.
